thread.title: Baylor QB Seth Russell's season is over because of neck injury
thread.title_full: Baylor QB Seth Russell's season is over because of neck injury

title: Baylor QB Seth Russell's season is over because of neck injury
text:
Baylor QB Seth Russell’s season is over because of neck injury Resize Text By Matt Bonesteel October 26 at 3:05 PM Follow @MattBonesteel (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) 
Baylor quarterback Seth Russell will miss the rest of the season after suffering a neck injury Saturday against Iowa State: Baylor QB Seth Russell will undergo surgery to his neck &miss remainder of 2015 season 
— Brett McMurphy (@McMurphyESPN) October 26, 2015 
ESPN’s Joe Schad says the second-ranked Bears are hopeful Russell will be able to resume his career at some point. Russell broke a bone in his neck against the Cyclones. 
Russell is averaging a national-best 10.5 yards per attempt this season, is tied for the national lead with 29 touchdown passes and leads the nation with a 189.72 quarterback rating. 
Assuming Russell will miss the rest of the season, Baylor will turn to true freshman Jarrett Stidham, who has completed 85.7 percent of his pass attempts this season for 331 yards and six scores. Baylor backup Jarrett Stidham, who played at Stephenville HS in Texas (where Art Briles coached), has 6 TDs in 28 passes 
— Mark Schlabach (@Mark_Schlabach) October 26, 2015 
The Bears next play Nov. 5 at Kansas State, so Stidham will have plenty of time to get in first-team reps. He was the No. 2 dual-threat quarterback recruit in the class of 2015, according to 247Sports . However, Baylor’s schedule gets much tougher from here on out, with games against No. 14 Oklahoma, No. 12 Oklahoma State and No. 5 TCU following the game at Kansas State. After spending the first 17 years of his Post career writing and editing, Matt and the printed paper had an amicable divorce in 2014. He's now blogging and editing for the Early Lead and the Post's other Web-based products. sports Success! Check your inbox for details.
